intro: Anthistiria cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are elongated and have a sharp, pointed tip, giving it its scientific name. Anthistiria cuspidata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
